meanings.definition: To engage in commercial or business transactions.
meanings.sent1: She was commercing with the local vendors to stock up her store.
meanings.sent2: The company has been commercing with international partners for years.
meanings.sent3: The cat was caught commercing with the neighbor's dog for treats.
meanings.sent4: The sun and clouds seemed to be commercing in a dance across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The children played a game of commercing, pretending to buy and sell imaginary items.

meanings.definition: To trade or do business with others.
meanings.sent1: The farmers were commercing their crops at the market.
meanings.sent2: It is common for countries to commerce goods across borders.
meanings.sent3: The birds were caught commercing for the best nesting spots.
meanings.sent4: The river and the sea seemed to be commercing water back and forth.
meanings.sent5: The siblings enjoyed commercing toys during playtime.

meanings.definition: The act of buying and selling goods or services.
meanings.sent1: Commercing has been the main source of income for the town.
meanings.sent2: Global commerce involves the exchange of products worldwide.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show depicted a humorous take on the world of commercing.
meanings.sent4: The painting symbolized the endless cycle of commercing in society.
meanings.sent5: The marketplace bustled with the sounds and sights of active commercing.
